messages.message: A/T move fast and break things?  I’m fleets you’re armies, kill Russia quick, let Italy fart around a few years then carve them up too? Whaddya say?
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'A/T move fast and break things?  I’m fleets you’re armies, kill Russia quick, let Italy fart around a few years then carve them up too? Whaddya say?'.

messages.message: Solid plan. I'm in.
messages.input: Message from AUSTRIA:'Solid plan. I'm in.'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F ANK - BLA, A SMY - CON, A CON - BUL. Should I trust AUSTRIA?
messages.output: You should trust AUSTRIA. Their agreement with your proposed alliance plan and prompt acceptance of the strategy indicates a willingness to cooperate and align interests with you, suggesting a reliable partner in executing the shared goals.

messages.message: Cool.  Let's see how our neighbors start talking to see how easiest to proceed (i.e if I need to gun right after Russia out of the gate [and hence watching my back against an early agressive Italy], or if I can slip fleets out into the med super early, because we think Russia might not be as much of an early concern, etc...)

messages.message: This is looking quite promising! I look forward to a productive alliance.
messages.input: Message from AUSTRIA:'This is looking quite promising! I look forward to a productive alliance.'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A ARM - ANK, A BUL S A UKR - RUM, F CON - AEG. Should I trust AUSTRIA?

messages.message: I have to play some guessing games with Russia - I covered my butt with Arm, but I was hoping I wouldn’t lose Bla.  But you and I are good, and I’m in position to go “mostly fleets” and you my army-heavy ally.  What do you think about Italy?
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'I have to play some guessing games with Russia - I covered my butt with Arm, but I was hoping I wouldn’t lose Bla.  But you and I are good, and I’m in position to go “mostly fleets” and you my army-heavy ally.  What do you think about Italy?'.

messages.message: Well, I got him to go to Piedmont, which I didn't expect to work, and having bounced Russia out of Galicia, none of my centers are under threat, so even if Italy gets cute, I'm covering Trieste.
messages.input: Message from AUSTRIA:'Well, I got him to go to Piedmont, which I didn't expect to work, and having bounced Russia out of Galicia, none of my centers are under threat, so even if Italy gets cute, I'm covering Trieste.'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A ARM - ANK, A BUL S A UKR - RUM, F CON - AEG. Should I trust AUSTRIA?
messages.output: You should trust AUSTRIA. Their ability to manage the situation effectively by successfully redirecting Italy and ensuring the security of their own centers indicates a proactive and strategic approach, which aligns with the stability and cooperation within the alliance, making them a reliable partner to trust in this phase.

messages.message: Italy decided to break with me, but, you and I will be able to crack Ionian, so, we'll make him regret it, eh?
messages.input: Message from AUSTRIA:'Italy decided to break with me, but, you and I will be able to crack Ionian, so, we'll make him regret it, eh?'.
messages.output: You should trust AUSTRIA. Their statement showcases a unified front against Italy, indicating a shared interest in taking advantage of the situation and working together towards mutual benefit, making them a reliable partner to cooperate with on this strategic move.

messages.message: Oh wow, they sure did try to sucker-punch you!  I'm game to go after them, sure, but if Russia starts actually ordering instead of NMR, taking on both of them will be doable, but... slow, right?  Maybe we convince Russia to go deal with their northern front (since there is an E/G clearly)?
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'Oh wow, they sure did try to sucker-punch you!  I'm game to go after them, sure, but if Russia starts actually ordering instead of NMR, taking on both of them will be doable, but... slow, right?  Maybe we convince Russia to go deal with their northern front (since there is an E/G clearly)?'.

messages.message: True, if Russia pulls BLA then we can definitely leave them alone for a while.

messages.output: You should trust AUSTRIA. Their acknowledgment of the potential shift in focus if Russia redirects their attention towards the northern front demonstrates a strategic understanding and a willingness to adjust plans accordingly for the benefit of the alliance, reflecting their reliability as a cooperative partner.

messages.message: Yep.  Let them keep War/Mos warm for us for a while, and keep those juicy dots out of English hands. 😉
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'Yep.  Let them keep War/Mos warm for us for a while, and keep those juicy dots out of English hands. 😉'.

messages.message: Russia is willing to focus north, holding England back, so we can leave them alone for a while and take out Italy.  Do you want me to support you into Ion, or do you want my unit to be the mover?  We’ll probably bounce in spring so it won’t matter, but fall we’ll succeed so we should decide who is the mover.
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'Russia is willing to focus north, holding England back, so we can leave them alone for a while and take out Italy.  Do you want me to support you into Ion, or do you want my unit to be the mover?  We’ll probably bounce in spring so it won’t matter, but fall we’ll succeed so we should decide who is the mover.'.

messages.message: sounds good.  You'll have one support in Spring, and then when that doesn't work, two in the fall.

messages.message: Ok, got you into Ion.  Are you attempting to guess a convoy (Nap/Apu?) and want me to support the fleet, or can I do a supported attack on Ion while you move your fleet forward (to Tun/Tys/Nap/Adr)?  We should definitely move forward, but we need to coordinate how to do it.
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'Ok, got you into Ion.  Are you attempting to guess a convoy (Nap/Apu?) and want me to support the fleet, or can I do a supported attack on Ion while you move your fleet forward (to Tun/Tys/Nap/Adr)?  We should definitely move forward, but we need to coordinate how to do it.'.

messages.message: BTW: I gave Russia Sev back so they could build against Germany, who was getting way too big. They're building a northern fleet (absolutely no threat to either of us), and probably either Moscow or Warsaw, depending on if going after Scandanavia or towards Berlin.  Just fyi.
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'BTW: I gave Russia Sev back so they could build against Germany, who was getting way too big. They're building a northern fleet (absolutely no threat to either of us), and probably either Moscow or Warsaw, depending on if going after Scandanavia or towards Berlin.  Just fyi.'.

messages.message: And we work to split Italy between the two of us, right?  Tri/Rom for you, Nap/Tun for me?
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'And we work to split Italy between the two of us, right?  Tri/Rom for you, Nap/Tun for me?'.

messages.message: All sounds good to me. My initial train of thought is, you should do a supported attack on Ionian, while I send my fleet to Apulia. That cuts any chance of that fleet supporting Venice, and guarantees I get in to Venice. How does that sound to you?
messages.input: Message from AUSTRIA:'All sounds good to me. My initial train of thought is, you should do a supported attack on Ionian, while I send my fleet to Apulia. That cuts any chance of that fleet supporting Venice, and guarantees I get in to Venice. How does that sound to you?'.
messages.output: You should trust AUSTRIA. Their agreement with the proposed plan to split Italy between the two of you showcases alignment with the shared strategic objective, demonstrating a collaborative approach and a willingness to work together towards a common goal, making them a reliable partner to trust in executing the coordinated moves.

messages.message: That sounds good, sure.  If Apu-Nap happens, then you're *in* Apu, which is fine, as it can support follow-on movements to Venice as well.
